conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine if the particle returns to its starting point after 3 seconds.
Graphs show velocity vs. time for a particle moving in a straight line. Calculate total displacement from t = 0 to t = 3 seconds.
Displacement is equal to the area under the v-t curve. Positive area represents forward displacement, negative area represents backward displacement.
From t = 0 to t = 1 s: Constant velocity of 2 m/s.
From t = 1 to t = 2 s: Linear decrease from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
From t = 2 to t = 3 s: Linear decrease from 0 m/s to -2 m/s.
Region 1 (0 to 1 s): Area = 2 m/s × 1 s = 2 m (positive displacement).
Region 2 (1 to 2 s): Area = (1/2) × 1 s × 2 m/s = 1 m (positive displacement).
Region 3 (2 to 3 s): Area = (1/2) × 1 s × 2 m/s = 1 m (negative displacement).
Total displacement = 2 m + 1 m - 1 m = 2 m.
Total positive area is larger than total negative area, confirming net positive displacement.
No, the particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
